DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Other Anatomic Site Administered Total Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the total dose of radiation administered to another anatomic site.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Other Anatomic Site Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Named locations of or within the body._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Named locations of, or within, the body.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Named locations of or within the body.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
